content.description: Start at the large chalky holds low in the middle of the north side of the sunshine boulder and move left onto the slopers, out to the arete and then up. This problem is essentially Smokey Desperado and the Sunshine Kid (which starts on the far right side) minus the first introductory five or so moves. This is number 8 on the back side of the Marty Karabin Map.
content.location: North side of the Sunshine boulder, big chalky holds. You can't miss it.

content.description: Start big edge then go left and up seam.
content.location: East face of Sunshine Boulder. 20th Street Boulders. #11 on the Marty Pocket Guide.

content.description: Start on the low triangular hold and go straight up and over the large point. #7 on the Marty Guide. It wasn't named so this was the name I gave it. Let know if it was named something different.
Low RT start? climb the arete, the big ledge is off. #9 on the Marty Guide.
content.location: Sunshine Boulder, Left Side, North Face

climbs.name: Smokey Desperado and the Sunshine Kid

content.description:
Start on the large obvious hold on the far right side. Traverse left passed a few more jugs to some slopers. Stay low on the traverse. Finish the traverse when you reach the arete and go up. There are many holds on the arete to grab, make sure you grab the right one.

 This climb takes some technique. The crux is getting to the arete from the slopers. This climb reminds me of the style of climbing found at Joe's Valley.
content.protection: One pad will suffice, but two will make you feel better.
content.location: The boulder to the West of "The Egg" near 20th Street. It's #5 on the Marty Karabin Guide.

content.description: Same start as Smokey Desperado (V6). do the left traversing hand moves starting on the big chalky jugs, drop down and to the left to the good low holds in the middle of the boulder. Instead of moving left on the bad slopers and finishing on the arete, go straight up using whatever combination of mediocre crimp, mediocre side pull or mediocre sloper that works for you. Listed as an unnamed V4 in the Marty Karabin guide
content.location: Start on the chalky jugs with bad feet (on the north side) at the far right (looking south) of the sunshine boulder.

content.description: SD, Good left start, up onto chunky loose blocks.
content.location: 20th Street Boulders. South side of boulder. #13 in the Marty Pocket Guide.

content.description: Sit start on the low triangular hold. Climb up and left and mantle the slope. #6 On the Marty Guide. This wasn't named so I gave it the name based of the mantle move.
Listed as #1 on the Marty Guide. A little chimes route starting in the little cave between the boulders. Start on the large ledge and go up and top out.
Sit start on the large holds and climb straight up. As the guidebooks says crack is off. Hence the name of the route. No named route #2 in the Marty Guide.
content.location: Sunshine Boulder far right side North face.

content.description: Start standing up using the large ledge and continue up the buttress. #10 on the Marty Guide. It wasn't named so I gave it this one. Probably good for the budding pebble wrestler.

Sit start on the large hold and climb the left to the crack and make your way up using good holds. This is #3 on Marty's guide. It was un named so I named it after the fact that many of this boulders problems start here. Let me know if it is named something different.
content.location: Sunshine Boulder, far right, North side.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on good crimp, launch yourself to the top and and climb up the point. #12 on the Marty Guide. Wasn't named. Gets sun all day.
Behind the egg boulder at the 20th street parking area.
